titleStmt.title: The prayse of all women, called Mulieru[m] pean Very fruytfull and delectable vnto all the reders. Loke [et] rede who that can. This boke is prayse to eche woman.
titleStmt.author: Gosynhyll, Edward.

titleStmt.title: The prayse of all women, called Mulieru[m] pean Very fruytfull and delectable vnto all the reders. Loke [et] rede who that can. This boke is prayse to eche woman.
titleStmt.author: Gosynhyll, Edward.

publicationStmt.publisher: In Fletestrete at the sygne of the George by me wyllyam Myddylton,

notesStmt.note: The author's name, Edward Gosynhyll, appears in acrostics on E3v-E4r and in full on E4r.
A reply to: The schole house of women.
Printer's name and address from colophon; publication date conjectured by STC.
Reproduction of the original in the Henry E. Huntington Library and Art Gallery.
